author: mbrain
content: <@159152274659082240> <@898563924440543283> so the Geth fork in the interop repo doesn't have any knowledge of the Capella fields. How do we want to move forward with 4844 as an upgrade on top of Capella?

author: roberto.bayardo
content: I created a devnet-v3 branch for all eip-4844 repos (eip4844-interop, prym, geth + erigon).  I'd recommend checking in any "Capella rebase" work into those branches so we don't introduce breaking changes to devnet2 <@281887943579271178> .  You should also add your lodestar submodule there.  yes we'll have to add knowledge of capella fields to each.

author: roberto.bayardo
content: Unless <@360491619402776577> or someone from the geth team is doing it, I can add capella fields to our geth fork.   I'm already looking at Erigon.  I believe <@159152274659082240> has made good progress on prysm.  [edit: Missed Marius' response above that withdrawal PR is in progress : we can wait on that before starting w/ Capella-enabling our 4844 Geth]

author: mbrain
content: Depending on Marius' timeline, we might prefer a quick stub impl in our geth fork?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: the code is here: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/25838

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I don't have the capacity to rebase, and I don't know if it makes sense to enable withdrawals for devnet3 if no other client than lodestar has withdrawals yet, but it can also work as a forcing function to get teams to finally ship withdrawals so we can start a withdrawal testnet ;)
